repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: Transcripts of speeches made at the 10th Anniversary Dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Transcript of ILR School 10th Anneversary Dinner speaches by Cornell President Deane Malott, ILR Dean Martin P. Catherwood, Senator Irving M. Ives, William Groat, Louis Hollander, Donald Shank, Phillips Bradley, and Jean McKelvey. For audio tape of the event see Collection /4191, Box 45, Item 4.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: ILR School 10th Anniversary Dinner, November 18, 1955 #/3086. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related Collections: /4191 F: ILR School Audio-Visual Department Films /4191 AV: ILR School Audio-Visual Department Video Cassette Collection

controlaccess.corpname: New York State School of Industrial and Labor Relations

did.unittitle: Transcript of speech by Martin P. Catherwood
Transcript of speech by Don Shank

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: November 18, 1955. Transcript was prepared from a tape recording of the event. The speakers, with the exception of Louis Hollander, revised their remarks during 1966 at the request of Professor James Morris. The revisions were minor. Mr. Hollander's remarks were revised by Professor Maurice Neufeld. These revisions, too, were minor. Transcript shows revisions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: November 18, 1955. Transcript was prepared from a tape recording of the event. The speakers, with the exception of Louis Hollander, revised their remarks during 1966 at the request of Professor James Morris. The revisions were minor. Mr. Hollander's remarks were revised by Professor Maurice Neufeld. These revisions, too, were minor. Transcript shows revisions. Copy 2.
